etymology.description: 啤(啤) (pí, "beer") and 酒(酒) (jiǔ, "alcohol") combine to form the word 啤酒(啤酒) (píjiǔ, "beer"). Here, 啤(啤) doesn't have a standalone meaning in Chinese outside of this word, but 酒(酒) is a general term for alcoholic beverages.
etymology.interpretation: 啤酒(啤酒) (píjiǔ, "beer") combines the element referring to beer specifically with the character for alcohol, indicating beer as a type of alcoholic beverage.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢喝啤酒(我喜歡喝啤酒)。
晚上和朋友一起喝啤酒(晚上和朋友一起喝啤酒)，聊聊天(聊聊天)。
examples.pinyin: Wǎnshàng hé péngyǒu yīqǐ hē píjiǔ, liáo liáotiān.
examples.english: In the evening, I drink beer with my friends and chat.
